task.title: Staging and committing changes
task.shortdesc: keeps track of all the changes you make to the content of your local repository. You can use the view to stage and commit your updates to the local repository.

step.cmd: In the Unstaged or untracked files area, choose the changes that you want to stage by performing one of the following actions:

choices.choice: To stage all the listed files, click Stage All.
To stage one or more files selectively, select the file or files and click Stage Selected.

step.cmd: In the Commit message area, use the text box to provide a meaningful commit message or use the drop-down list to choose a previously used commit.

result.p: The numbered indicator on the Push icon is incremented and you can now publish your commit in the remote repository.
